flag-definitions.h

5// This file defines all of the flags. It is separated into different section,
6// for Debug, Release, Logging and Profiling, etc. To add a new flag, find the
7// correct section, and use one of the DEFINE_ macros, without a trailing ';'.
8//
9// This include does not have a guard, because it is a template-style include,
10// which can be included multiple times in different modes. It expects to have
11// a mode defined before it's included. The modes are FLAG_MODE_... below:
12//
13// PRESUBMIT_INTENTIONALLY_MISSING_INCLUDE_GUARD
14
15#define DEFINE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag) \
16 DEFINE_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, true)
17
18// A weak implication will be overwritten by a normal implication or by an
19// explicit flag.
20#define DEFINE_WEAK_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag) \
21 DEFINE_WEAK_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, true)
22
23#define DEFINE_WEAK_NEG_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag) \
24 DEFINE_WEAK_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, false)
25
26#define DEFINE_NEG_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag) \
27 DEFINE_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, false)
28
29#define DEFINE_NEG_NEG_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag) \
30 DEFINE_NEG_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, false)
31
32#define DEFINE_WEAK_NEG_NEG_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag) \
33 DEFINE_WEAK_NEG_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, false)
34
35// With FLAG_MODE_DECLARE we declare the fields in the {FlagValues} struct.
36// Read-only flags are static constants instead of fields.
37#if defined(FLAG_MODE_DECLARE)
38#define FLAG_FULL(ftype, ctype, nam, def, cmt) FlagValue<ctype> nam{def};
39#define FLAG_READONLY(ftype, ctype, nam, def, cmt) \
40 static constexpr FlagValue<ctype> nam{def};
41
42// We need to define all of our default values so that the Flag structure can
43// access them by pointer. These are just used internally inside of one .cc,
44// for MODE_META, so there is no impact on the flags interface.
45#elif defined(FLAG_MODE_DEFINE_DEFAULTS)
46#define FLAG_FULL(ftype, ctype, nam, def, cmt) \
47 static constexpr ctype FLAGDEFAULT_##nam{def};
48#define FLAG_READONLY(ftype, ctype, nam, def, cmt) \
49 static constexpr ctype FLAGDEFAULT_##nam{def};
50
51// We want to write entries into our meta data table, for internal parsing and
52// printing / etc in the flag parser code.
53#elif defined(FLAG_MODE_META)
54#define FLAG_FULL(ftype, ctype, nam, def, cmt) \
55 {Flag::TYPE_##ftype, #nam, &v8_flags.nam, &FLAGDEFAULT_##nam, cmt, false},
56// Readonly flags don't pass the value pointer since the struct expects a
57// mutable value. That's okay since the value always equals the default.
58#define FLAG_READONLY(ftype, ctype, nam, def, cmt) \
59 {Flag::TYPE_##ftype, #nam, nullptr, &FLAGDEFAULT_##nam, cmt, false},
60#define FLAG_ALIAS(ftype, ctype, alias, nam) \
61 {Flag::TYPE_##ftype, #alias, &v8_flags.nam, &FLAGDEFAULT_##nam, \
62 "alias for --" #nam, false}, // NOLINT(whitespace/indent)
63
64// We produce the code to set flags when it is implied by another flag.
65#elif defined(FLAG_MODE_DEFINE_IMPLICATIONS)
66#define DEFINE_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, value) \
67 changed |= TriggerImplication(v8_flags.whenflag, #whenflag, \
68 &v8_flags.thenflag, #thenflag, value, false);
69
70// A weak implication will be overwritten by a normal implication or by an
71// explicit flag.
72#define DEFINE_WEAK_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, value) \
73 changed |= TriggerImplication(v8_flags.whenflag, #whenflag, \
74 &v8_flags.thenflag, #thenflag, value, true);
75
76#define DEFINE_GENERIC_IMPLICATION(whenflag, statement) \
77 if (v8_flags.whenflag) statement;
78
79#define DEFINE_NEG_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, value) \
80 changed |= TriggerImplication(!v8_flags.whenflag, "!" #whenflag, \
81 &v8_flags.thenflag, #thenflag, value, false);
82
83#define DEFINE_WEAK_NEG_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, value) \
84 changed |= TriggerImplication(!v8_flags.whenflag, "!" #whenflag, \
85 &v8_flags.thenflag, #thenflag, value, true);
86
87// We apply a generic macro to the flags.
88#elif defined(FLAG_MODE_APPLY)
89
90#define FLAG_FULL FLAG_MODE_APPLY
91
92#else
93#error No mode supplied when including flags.defs
94#endif
95
96// Dummy defines for modes where it is not relevant.
97#ifndef FLAG_FULL
98#define FLAG_FULL(ftype, ctype, nam, def, cmt)
99#endif
100
101#ifndef FLAG_READONLY
102#define FLAG_READONLY(ftype, ctype, nam, def, cmt)
103#endif
104
105#ifndef FLAG_ALIAS
106#define FLAG_ALIAS(ftype, ctype, alias, nam)
107#endif
108
109#ifndef DEFINE_VALUE_IMPLICATION
110#define DEFINE_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, value)
111#endif
112
113#ifndef DEFINE_WEAK_VALUE_IMPLICATION
114#define DEFINE_WEAK_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, value)
115#endif
116
117#ifndef DEFINE_GENERIC_IMPLICATION
118#define DEFINE_GENERIC_IMPLICATION(whenflag, statement)
119#endif
120
121#ifndef DEFINE_NEG_VALUE_IMPLICATION
122#define DEFINE_NEG_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, value)
123#endif
124
125#ifndef DEFINE_WEAK_NEG_VALUE_IMPLICATION
126#define DEFINE_WEAK_NEG_VALUE_IMPLICATION(whenflag, thenflag, value)
127#endif

131#endif // DEBUG_BOOL

137#endif

139// Supported ARM configurations are:
140// "armv6": ARMv6 + VFPv2
141// "armv7": ARMv7 + VFPv3-D32 + NEON
142// "armv7+sudiv": ARMv7 + VFPv4-D32 + NEON + SUDIV
143// "armv8": ARMv8 (including all of the above)
144#if !defined(ARM_TEST_NO_FEATURE_PROBE) || \
145 (defined(CAN_USE_ARMV8_INSTRUCTIONS) && \
146 defined(CAN_USE_ARMV7_INSTRUCTIONS) && defined(CAN_USE_SUDIV) && \
147 defined(CAN_USE_NEON) && defined(CAN_USE_VFP3_INSTRUCTIONS))
148#define ARM_ARCH_DEFAULT "armv8"
149#elif defined(CAN_USE_ARMV7_INSTRUCTIONS) && defined(CAN_USE_SUDIV) && \
150 defined(CAN_USE_NEON) && defined(CAN_USE_VFP3_INSTRUCTIONS)
151#define ARM_ARCH_DEFAULT "armv7+sudiv"
152#elif defined(CAN_USE_ARMV7_INSTRUCTIONS) && defined(CAN_USE_NEON) && \
153 defined(CAN_USE_VFP3_INSTRUCTIONS)
154#define ARM_ARCH_DEFAULT "armv7"
155#else
156#define ARM_ARCH_DEFAULT "armv6"
157#endif
158
159#ifdef V8_OS_WIN
160#define ENABLE_LOG_COLOUR false
161#else
162#define ENABLE_LOG_COLOUR true
163#endif
164
165#define DEFINE_BOOL(nam, def, cmt) FLAG(BOOL, bool, nam, def, cmt)
166#define DEFINE_BOOL_READONLY(nam, def, cmt) \
167 FLAG_READONLY(BOOL, bool, nam, def, cmt)
168#define DEFINE_MAYBE_BOOL(nam, cmt) \
169 FLAG(MAYBE_BOOL, base::Optional<bool>, nam, base::nullopt, cmt)
170#define DEFINE_INT(nam, def, cmt) FLAG(INT, int, nam, def, cmt)
171#define DEFINE_UINT(nam, def, cmt) FLAG(UINT, unsigned int, nam, def, cmt)
172#define DEFINE_UINT_READONLY(nam, def, cmt) \
173 FLAG_READONLY(UINT, unsigned int, nam, def, cmt)
174#define DEFINE_UINT64(nam, def, cmt) FLAG(UINT64, uint64_t, nam, def, cmt)
175#define DEFINE_FLOAT(nam, def, cmt) FLAG(FLOAT, double, nam, def, cmt)
176#define DEFINE_SIZE_T(nam, def, cmt) FLAG(SIZE_T, size_t, nam, def, cmt)
177#define DEFINE_STRING(nam, def, cmt) FLAG(STRING, const char*, nam, def, cmt)
178#define DEFINE_ALIAS_BOOL(alias, nam) FLAG_ALIAS(BOOL, bool, alias, nam)
179#define DEFINE_ALIAS_INT(alias, nam) FLAG_ALIAS(INT, int, alias, nam)
180#define DEFINE_ALIAS_FLOAT(alias, nam) FLAG_ALIAS(FLOAT, double, alias, nam)
181#define DEFINE_ALIAS_SIZE_T(alias, nam) FLAG_ALIAS(SIZE_T, size_t, alias, nam)
182#define DEFINE_ALIAS_STRING(alias, nam) \
183 FLAG_ALIAS(STRING, const char*, alias, nam)
184
185#ifdef DEBUG
186#define DEFINE_DEBUG_BOOL DEFINE_BOOL
187#else
188#define DEFINE_DEBUG_BOOL DEFINE_BOOL_READONLY
189#endif
190
191//
192// Flags in all modes.
193//
194#define FLAG FLAG_FULL
195
196// Experimental features.
197// Features that are still considered experimental and which are not ready for
198// fuzz testing should be defined using this macro. The feature will then imply
199// --experimental, which will indicate to the user that they are running an
200// experimental configuration of V8. Experimental features are always disabled
201// by default. When these features mature, the flag should first turn into a
202// regular feature flag (still disabled by default) and then ideally be staged
203// behind (for example) --future before being enabled by default.
204DEFINE_BOOL(experimental, false,
205 "Indicates that V8 is running with experimental features enabled. "
206 "This flag is typically not set explicitly but instead enabled as "
207 "an implication of other flags which enable experimental features.")
208#define DEFINE_EXPERIMENTAL_FEATURE(nam, cmt) \
209 FLAG(BOOL, bool, nam, false, cmt " (experimental)") \
210 DEFINE_IMPLICATION(nam, experimental)
211
212// ATTENTION: This is set to true by default in d8. But for API compatibility,
213// it generally defaults to false.
214DEFINE_BOOL(abort_on_contradictory_flags, false,
215 "Disallow flags or implications overriding each other.")
216// This implication is also hard-coded into the flags processing to make sure it
217// becomes active before we even process subsequent flags.
218DEFINE_NEG_IMPLICATION(fuzzing, abort_on_contradictory_flags)
219// As abort_on_contradictory_flags, but it will simply exit with return code 0.
220DEFINE_BOOL(exit_on_contradictory_flags, false,
221 "Exit with return code 0 on contradictory flags.")
222// We rely on abort_on_contradictory_flags to turn on the analysis.
223DEFINE_WEAK_IMPLICATION(exit_on_contradictory_flags,
224 abort_on_contradictory_flags)
225// This is not really a flag, it affects the interpretation of the next flag but
226// doesn't become permanently true when specified. This only works for flags
227// defined in this file, but not for d8 flags defined in src/d8/d8.cc.
228DEFINE_BOOL(allow_overwriting_for_next_flag, false,
229 "temporary disable flag contradiction to allow overwriting just "
230 "the next flag")
231
232// Flags for language modes and experimental language features.
233DEFINE_BOOL(use_strict, false, "enforce strict mode")
234
235DEFINE_BOOL(trace_temporal, false, "trace temporal code")
236
237DEFINE_BOOL(harmony, false, "enable all completed harmony features")
238DEFINE_BOOL(harmony_shipping, true, "enable all shipped harmony features")
239
240DEFINE_BOOL(js_staging, false, "enable all completed JavaScript features")
241DEFINE_BOOL(js_shipping, true, "enable all shipped JavaScript features")

243// Update bootstrapper.cc whenever adding a new feature flag.
244
245// Features that are still work in progress (behind individual flags).
246//
247// The "harmony" naming is now outdated and will no longer be used for new JS
248// features. Use the JAVASCRIPT macros instead.
249//
250// TODO(v8:14214): Remove --harmony flags once transition is complete.
251#define HARMONY_INPROGRESS_BASE(V) \
252 V(harmony_weak_refs_with_cleanup_some, \
253 "harmony weak references with FinalizationRegistry.prototype.cleanupSome") \
254 V(harmony_temporal, "Temporal") \
255 V(harmony_shadow_realm, "harmony ShadowRealm") \
256 V(harmony_struct, "harmony structs, shared structs, and shared arrays") \
257 V(harmony_import_assertions, "harmony import assertions (deprecated)")
258
259#define JAVASCRIPT_INPROGRESS_FEATURES_BASE(V) \
260 V(js_explicit_resource_management, "explicit resource management") \
261 V(js_float16array, \
262 "Float16Array, Math.f16round, DataView.getFloat16, DataView.setFloat16")
263
264#ifdef V8_INTL_SUPPORT
265#define HARMONY_INPROGRESS(V) \
266 HARMONY_INPROGRESS_BASE(V) \
267 V(harmony_intl_best_fit_matcher, "Intl BestFitMatcher") \
268 /* Following two flags should ship the same time but may stage */ \
269 /* differently . */ \
270 V(harmony_remove_intl_locale_info_getters, \
271 "Remove Obsoleted Intl Locale Info getters") \
272 V(harmony_intl_locale_info_func, "Intl Locale Info API as functions") \
273 V(harmony_intl_duration_format, "Intl DurationFormat API")
274
275#define JAVASCRIPT_INPROGRESS_FEATURES(V) JAVASCRIPT_INPROGRESS_FEATURES_BASE(V)
276#else
277#define HARMONY_INPROGRESS(V) HARMONY_INPROGRESS_BASE(V)
278#define JAVASCRIPT_INPROGRESS_FEATURES(V) JAVASCRIPT_INPROGRESS_FEATURES_BASE(V)
279#endif

282#define HARMONY_STAGED_BASE(V)
283
284#define JAVASCRIPT_STAGED_FEATURES_BASE(V)

286DEFINE_WEAK_IMPLICATION(harmony_rab_gsab_transfer, harmony_rab_gsab)

291#else

297#define HARMONY_SHIPPING_BASE(V) \
298 V(harmony_rab_gsab, \
299 "harmony ResizableArrayBuffer / GrowableSharedArrayBuffer") \
300 V(harmony_rab_gsab_transfer, "harmony ArrayBuffer.transfer") \
301 V(harmony_array_grouping, "harmony array grouping") \
302 V(harmony_array_from_async, "harmony Array.fromAsync") \
303 V(harmony_iterator_helpers, "JavaScript iterator helpers") \
304 V(harmony_set_methods, "harmony Set Methods") \
305 V(harmony_import_attributes, "harmony import attributes")
306
307#define JAVASCRIPT_SHIPPING_FEATURES_BASE(V) \
308 V(js_promise_withresolvers, "Promise.withResolvers") \
309 V(js_regexp_duplicate_named_groups, "RegExp duplicate named groups") \
310 V(js_regexp_modifiers, "RegExp modifiers")
311
312#ifdef V8_INTL_SUPPORT
313#define HARMONY_SHIPPING(V) HARMONY_SHIPPING_BASE(V)
314#define JAVASCRIPT_SHIPPING_FEATURES(V) JAVASCRIPT_SHIPPING_FEATURES_BASE(V)
315#else
316#define HARMONY_SHIPPING(V) HARMONY_SHIPPING_BASE(V)
317#define JAVASCRIPT_SHIPPING_FEATURES(V) JAVASCRIPT_SHIPPING_FEATURES_BASE(V)
318#endif
319
320// Once a shipping feature has proved stable in the wild, it will be dropped
321// from HARMONY_SHIPPING, all occurrences of the FLAG_ variable are removed,
322// and associated tests are moved from the harmony directory to the appropriate
323// esN directory.
324//
325// In-progress features are not code complete and are considered experimental,
326// i.e. not ready for fuzz testing.
327
328#define FLAG_INPROGRESS_FEATURES(id, description) \
329 DEFINE_BOOL(id, false, \
330 "enable " #description " (in progress / experimental)") \
331 DEFINE_IMPLICATION(id, experimental)
332HARMONY_INPROGRESS(FLAG_INPROGRESS_FEATURES)
333JAVASCRIPT_INPROGRESS_FEATURES(FLAG_INPROGRESS_FEATURES)
334#undef FLAG_INPROGRESS_FEATURES
335
336#define FLAG_STAGED_FEATURES(id, description) \
337 DEFINE_BOOL(id, false, "enable " #description) \
338 DEFINE_IMPLICATION(harmony, id) \
339 DEFINE_IMPLICATION(js_staging, id)
340HARMONY_STAGED(FLAG_STAGED_FEATURES)
341JAVASCRIPT_STAGED_FEATURES(FLAG_STAGED_FEATURES)
342DEFINE_IMPLICATION(harmony, js_staging)
343#undef FLAG_STAGED_FEATURES
344
345#define FLAG_SHIPPING_FEATURES(id, description) \
346 DEFINE_BOOL(id, true, "enable " #description) \
347 DEFINE_NEG_NEG_IMPLICATION(harmony_shipping, id) \
348 DEFINE_NEG_NEG_IMPLICATION(js_shipping, id)
349HARMONY_SHIPPING(FLAG_SHIPPING_FEATURES)
350JAVASCRIPT_SHIPPING_FEATURES(FLAG_SHIPPING_FEATURES)
351DEFINE_NEG_NEG_IMPLICATION(harmony_shipping, js_shipping)
352#undef FLAG_SHIPPING_FEATURES

386DEFINE_BOOL(stress_snapshot, false,
387 "disables sharing of the read-only heap for testing")
388// Incremental marking is incompatible with the stress_snapshot mode;
389// specifically, serialization may clear bytecode arrays from shared function
390// infos which the MarkCompactCollector (running concurrently) may still need.
391// See also https://crbug.com/v8/10882.
392//
393// Note: This is not an issue in production because we don't clear SFI's
394// there (that only happens in mksnapshot and in --stress-snapshot mode).
395DEFINE_NEG_IMPLICATION(stress_snapshot, incremental_marking)
396

525DEFINE_BOOL(force_emit_interrupt_budget_checks, false,
526 "force emit tier-up logic from all non-turbofan code, even if it "
527 "is the top enabled tier")
528#ifdef V8_ENABLE_MAGLEV
529DEFINE_BOOL(maglev, true, "enable the maglev optimizing compiler")
530#if !ENABLE_MAGLEV
531// Enable Maglev on Future for platforms in which it's not enabled by default
532// (eg, Android).
533DEFINE_WEAK_IMPLICATION(future, maglev)
534#endif
535DEFINE_EXPERIMENTAL_FEATURE(
536 maglev_future,
537 "enable maglev features that we want to ship in the not-too-far future")
538DEFINE_IMPLICATION(maglev_future, maglev)

540 optimize_on_next_call_optimizes_to_maglev, false,
541 "make OptimizeFunctionOnNextCall optimize to maglev instead of turbofan")

543// We stress maglev by setting a very low interrupt budget for maglev. This
544// way, we still gather *some* feedback before compiling optimized code.
545DEFINE_BOOL(stress_maglev, false, "trigger maglev compilation earlier")
546DEFINE_IMPLICATION(stress_maglev, maglev)
547DEFINE_WEAK_VALUE_IMPLICATION(stress_maglev, invocation_count_for_maglev, 4)
548
549#else

551DEFINE_BOOL_READONLY(

554DEFINE_BOOL_READONLY(stress_maglev, false, "trigger maglev compilation earlier")
555DEFINE_BOOL_READONLY(
556 optimize_on_next_call_optimizes_to_maglev, false,

879DEFINE_INT(invocation_count_for_turbofan, 3000,
880 "invocation count required for optimizing with TurboFan")
881DEFINE_INT(invocation_count_for_osr, 500, "invocation count required for OSR")
882DEFINE_INT(osr_to_tierup, 1,
883 "number to decrease the invocation budget by when we follow OSR")
884DEFINE_INT(minimum_invocations_after_ic_update, 500,
885 "How long to minimally wait after IC update before tier up")
886DEFINE_INT(minimum_invocations_before_optimization, 2,
887 "Minimum number of invocations we need before non-OSR optimization")
888
889// Tiering: JIT fuzzing.
890//
891// When --jit-fuzzing is enabled, various tiering related thresholds are
892// lowered so that the different JIT tiers are reached roughly within a few
893// dozen executions of the code instead of a few hundred or thousand. As a rule
894// of thumb, aiming for things to happen 5x to 10x sooner in this mode than
895// they otherwise would is probably not unreasonable.
896DEFINE_BOOL(jit_fuzzing, false,
897 "Set JIT tiering thresholds suitable for JIT fuzzing")
898// Tier up to Sparkplug should happen after a handful o executions in ignition.
899DEFINE_NEG_IMPLICATION(jit_fuzzing, lazy_feedback_allocation)
900DEFINE_NEG_IMPLICATION(jit_fuzzing, baseline_batch_compilation)
901// Tier up to Maglev should happen soon afterwards.
902DEFINE_VALUE_IMPLICATION(jit_fuzzing, invocation_count_for_maglev, 10)
903// And tier up to Turbofan should happen after a couple dozen or so executions.
904DEFINE_VALUE_IMPLICATION(jit_fuzzing, invocation_count_for_turbofan, 20)
905// Additionally, some other JIT-related thresholds should also be lowered.
906DEFINE_VALUE_IMPLICATION(jit_fuzzing, invocation_count_for_osr, 5)
907DEFINE_VALUE_IMPLICATION(jit_fuzzing, invocation_count_for_maglev_osr, 1)
908DEFINE_VALUE_IMPLICATION(jit_fuzzing, minimum_invocations_after_ic_update, 5)
909
910#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
911// Wasm tiering thresholds.
912DEFINE_VALUE_IMPLICATION(jit_fuzzing, wasm_wrapper_tiering_budget, 1)
913DEFINE_VALUE_IMPLICATION(jit_fuzzing, wasm_tiering_budget, 1)
914DEFINE_IMPLICATION(jit_fuzzing, wasm_inlining_ignore_call_counts)
915#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY

1020// Internalize into a shared string table in the shared isolate
1021DEFINE_BOOL(shared_string_table, false, "internalize strings into shared table")
1022DEFINE_IMPLICATION(harmony_struct, shared_string_table)
1023DEFINE_EXPERIMENTAL_FEATURE(
1024 always_use_string_forwarding_table,
1025 "use string forwarding table instead of thin strings for all strings")
1026// With --always-use-string-forwarding-table, we can have young generation
1027// string entries in the forwarding table, requiring table updates when these
1028// strings get promoted to old space. Parallel GCs in client isolates
1029// (enabled by --shared-string-table) are not supported using a single shared
1030// forwarding table.
1031DEFINE_NEG_IMPLICATION(shared_string_table, always_use_string_forwarding_table)
1032
1033DEFINE_BOOL(transition_strings_during_gc_with_stack, false,
1034 "Transition strings during a full GC with stack")
1035

1570// Declare command-line flags for Wasm features. Warning: avoid using these
1571// flags directly in the implementation. Instead accept wasm::WasmFeatures
1572// for configurability.
1573#include "src/wasm/wasm-feature-flags.h"
1574
1575#define DECL_WASM_FLAG(feat, desc, val) \
1576 DEFINE_BOOL(experimental_wasm_##feat, val, "enable " desc " for Wasm")
1577#define DECL_EXPERIMENTAL_WASM_FLAG(feat, desc, val) \
1578 DEFINE_EXPERIMENTAL_FEATURE(experimental_wasm_##feat, \
1579 "enable " desc " for Wasm")
1580// Experimental wasm features imply --experimental and get the " (experimental)"
1581// suffix.
1582FOREACH_WASM_EXPERIMENTAL_FEATURE_FLAG(DECL_EXPERIMENTAL_WASM_FLAG)
1583// Staging and shipped features do not imply --experimental.
1584FOREACH_WASM_STAGING_FEATURE_FLAG(DECL_WASM_FLAG)
1585FOREACH_WASM_SHIPPED_FEATURE_FLAG(DECL_WASM_FLAG)
1586#undef DECL_WASM_FLAG
1587#undef DECL_EXPERIMENTAL_WASM_FLAG
1588
1589DEFINE_IMPLICATION(experimental_wasm_stack_switching, experimental_wasm_jspi)
1590
1591DEFINE_IMPLICATION(experimental_wasm_jspi, experimental_wasm_type_reflection)
1592
1593DEFINE_BOOL(wasm_staging, false, "enable staged wasm features")
1594
1595#define WASM_STAGING_IMPLICATION(feat, desc, val) \
1596 DEFINE_IMPLICATION(wasm_staging, experimental_wasm_##feat)
1597FOREACH_WASM_STAGING_FEATURE_FLAG(WASM_STAGING_IMPLICATION)
1598#undef WASM_STAGING_IMPLICATION
1599

2559DEFINE_BOOL(

2562 "intrinsics to fail silently (e.g. return undefined) on invalid usage.")
2563
2564// When fuzzing, always compile functions twice and ensure that the generated
2565// bytecode is the same. This can help find bugs such as crbug.com/1394403 as it
2566// avoids the need for bytecode aging to kick in to trigger the recomplication.
2567DEFINE_WEAK_NEG_IMPLICATION(fuzzing, lazy)

2578// Sandbox-related flags.
2579//
2580#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
2581DEFINE_BOOL(sandbox_testing, false,
2582 "Enable sandbox testing mode. Useful for demonstrating and "
2583 "validating sandbox bypasses. This exposes the memory corruption "
2584 "API and enables the sandbox crash filter to filter out crashes "
2585 "that do not represent a sandbox bypass")
2586#else
2587DEFINE_BOOL_READONLY(
2588 sandbox_testing, false,
2589 "Enable sandbox testing mode. Useful for demonstrating and validating "
2590 "sandbox bypasses. This exposes the memory corruption API and enables the "
2591 "sandbox crash filter to filter out crashes that do not represent a "
2592 "sandbox bypass")
2593#endif
2594
2595#ifdef V8_ENABLE_MEMORY_CORRUPTION_API
2596// Sandbox fuzzing mode requires the memory corruption API.
2597DEFINE_BOOL(sandbox_fuzzing, false,
2598 "Enable sandbox fuzzing mode. This exposes the memory corruption "
2599 "API and enables the sandbox crash filter, causing all crashes "
2600 "that are not sandbox violations to be ignored.")
2601#else
2602DEFINE_BOOL_READONLY(
2603 sandbox_fuzzing, false,
2604 "Enable sandbox fuzzing mode. This exposes the memory corruption API and "
2605 "enables the sandbox crash filter, causing all crashes that are not "
2606 "sandbox violations to be ignored.")
2607#endif
2608
2609// Sandbox testing mode requires soft abort so that DCHECKs are skipped over
2610// and other fatal errors lead to normal process termination as they do not
2611// represent sandbox violations.
2612DEFINE_IMPLICATION(sandbox_testing, soft_abort)
2613DEFINE_IMPLICATION(sandbox_fuzzing, soft_abort)
2614
2615// Only one of these can be enabled.
2616DEFINE_NEG_IMPLICATION(sandbox_fuzzing, sandbox_testing)
2617DEFINE_NEG_IMPLICATION(sandbox_testing, sandbox_fuzzing)
